questions.question: For the reaction N₂(g) + 3H₂(g) ⇌ 2NH₃(g) + heat, what effect will increasing the temperature have on the equilibrium?

answers.d: Shift to the right, then to the left

explanations.a: Correct. Increasing the temperature favors the endothermic direction, which is the reverse (reactant) direction in this exothermic reaction.
explanations.b: Incorrect. This would happen if the reaction were endothermic.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Changes in temperature do affect equilibrium.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The reaction does not shift back and forth immediately in this way.

questions.question: For the reaction 2SO₂(g) + O₂(g) ⇌ 2SO₃(g), which of the following will increase the yield of SO₃?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Decreasing pressure shifts equilibrium toward more gas molecules (reactants).
explanations.b: Correct. Increasing the concentration of a reactant (O₂) will shift the equilibrium towards the product (SO₃).
explanations.c: Incorrect. Adding product shifts equilibrium to the left.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Increasing temperature may not favor product formation if the reaction is exothermic.

questions.question: You increased the concentration of reactant A, and the simulation showed a sharp shift toward product formation. If you immediately double the concentration of product B, what would most likely happen next?

answers.a: Reaction shifts further to the right
answers.b: Reaction shifts to the left to counter the excess B

explanations.a: Incorrect. Increasing product concentration does not push the reaction further forward.
explanations.b: Correct. The system will shift left to oppose the increase in product B.
explanations.c: Incorrect. The system responds to changes even if equilibrium was previously reached.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Equilibrium reactions remain reversible under standard conditions.

questions.question: In the simulation, when you removed some product but did not add any reactants, the reaction still shifted toward the products. Why?

answers.a: The system tries to restore balance by forming more product
answers.c: Reactants are unstable and must convert

explanations.a: Correct. Removing product causes the equilibrium to shift right to restore lost products.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Pressure only changes when gas volume or quantity changes.
explanations.c: Incorrect. This is not necessarily true for all reactions.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Heat behavior depends on reaction type, not product removal.

questions.question: A catalyst is added to a reactor where equilibrium has already been established. What is its effect?

answers.a: It increases the yield of the products
answers.b: It has no effect since equilibrium is already reached
answers.c: It helps re-establish equilibrium more quickly if disturbed
answers.d: It lowers the temperature of the system

explanations.a: Incorrect. Catalysts do not affect equilibrium yield.
explanations.b: Incorrect. It doesn’t affect the position but aids reestablishment if disturbed.
explanations.c: Correct. A catalyst speeds up both the forward and reverse reactions, helping to re-establish equilibrium faster.
